content:
User: C:\ai-execution-system>git filter-repo --force --path deployment/terraform/.terraform --strip-prefix deployment/terraform/.terraform 'git' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

Gemini: This error now strongly suggests that while pip install git-filter-repo likely succeeded in installing the tool as a Python package, the executable for git-filter-repo is not in a directory that's currently in your system's PATH.

Let's verify a couple of things to pinpoint this:

Verify git-filter-repo.exe Location:

Please go to the C:\Program Files\Python313\Scripts directory using File Explorer.

Do you see a file named git-filter-repo.exe inside the C:\Program Files\Python313\Scripts directory?

It should be there if pip install git-filter-repo was successful. Please confirm if you can find git-filter-repo.exe in that Scripts directory.

Double-Check System Path Variable (Again):

You've added C:\Program Files\Python313\Scripts to your System Path, which is correct. But let's just double-check to be absolutely sure it's still there and spelled correctly.

Open the System Environment Variables window again (Windows key -> "environment variables" -> "Edit the system environment variables" -> "Environment Variables...").
In the "System variables" section, select the Path variable and click "Edit...".
Confirm that C:\Program Files\Python313\Scripts is still listed as one of the entries in your System Path variable and that it is spelled correctly.
Is C:\Program Files\Python313\Scripts definitely in your System Path list right now?

After you confirm these two points, let me know your findings, and we'll figure out why git filter-repo command is still not being recognized. We are really close to the finish line now!
